intro: Dendrobium saruwagedicum, commonly known as the Saruwagedi orchid, is a species of epiphytic orchid native to the mountainous regions of Indonesia. It is characterized by its long, cane-like pseudobulbs and clusters of fragrant, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, humid conditions with indirect light. Its leaves are usually elongated and革质 (leathery), adapting to its harsh mountain environment. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a valuable and endangered species in conservation efforts.
